content: Association of publishers in Singapore The **Singapore Book Publishers Association** (SBPA) was incorporated in May 1968 with 22 company members, 14 of which were of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) origin. As of 1 July 2016 the association has 64 members engaged in a wide range of publishing, marketing and distribution activities. These are in the areas of educational [textbooks](/wiki/Textbooks), [children's books](/wiki/Children%27s_books), general and trade books, academic and scholarly publications, reference materials and some electronic publications. The main aims of the association are to encourage fair trade practices and maintain high standards of workmanship and service in the publishing business; to encourage the widest possible distribution of printed books in Singapore in particular and throughout the world in general; and to promote and protect, by all lawful means, the interests of the [publishers](/wiki/Publishers) in Singapore.
